title: How to Use Your AirPods as Hearing Assistants

steps.title: Unlock the screen of your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Unlock the screen of your iPhone or iPad. If your AirPods are already connected to your phone or tablet, skip to Enabling Live Listening .

steps.title: Hold your AirPods close to your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Hold your AirPods close to your iPhone or iPad. In a few seconds, the ″AirPods″ window will appear on the screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Connect.
steps.content: Tap Connect . The word ″Done″ will appear once the AirPods are connected. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open your Settings .
steps.content: Open your Settings . You’ll usually find it on the home screen. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Control Center.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Control Center . It’s in the third group of settings. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Customize Controls.
steps.content: Tap Customize Controls . [6] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Hearing.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Hearing . It’s under the ″MORE CONTROLS″ header. You can now quickly access Live Listening from the Control Center. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Control Center on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Control Center on your iPhone or iPad. If you’re using an iPhone X, swipe down from the top-right corner of the screen. Other iPhone and iPad users should swipe up from the bottom of the screen. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap and hold the audio/music square.
steps.content: Tap and hold the audio/music square. It’s the square at the top-right corner of the Control Center. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the sound icon.
steps.content: Tap the sound icon. It’s the triangle with several rounded lines at the top-right corner of the screen. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Select your AirPods.
steps.content: Select your AirPods. All sound on your iPhone or iPad will now be routed through your AirPods. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tap a blank area on the screen to return to the Control Center.
steps.content: Tap a blank area on the screen to return to the Control Center. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Live Listen icon.
steps.content: Tap the Live Listen icon. It’s the ear icon at the bottom of the Control Center. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Live Listen.
steps.content: Tap Live Listen . Live Listen is now enabled.

steps.title: Aim the bottom of your iPhone or iPad toward the sound or person you want to hear.
steps.content: Aim the bottom of your iPhone or iPad toward the sound or person you want to hear. Get as close as you can to the source of the sound. Now that the microphone is pointed at the source, your iPhone or iPad will strip out most other ambient sounds so you can hear the desired sound/conversation more clearly. [14] X Research source Use your iPhone or iPad’s volume controls to adjust the sound to your liking.

steps.title: Disable Live Listen when you’re finished.
steps.content: Disable Live Listen when you’re finished. To turn it off, return to the Control Center, tap the ear icon again, and then tap Live Listen .
